Key Match Events: Bradley Beal came off the bench for the first time in nine years and scored 25 points.
Tyrese Maxey had 31 points and 10 assists for the Sixers.
Kelly Oubre added 26 points for the 76ers.
Phoenix went on a 25-6 run in the third quarter, turning a seven-point deficit into a 12-point lead.
The Suns shot 14-for-30 (46.7%) from beyond the arc, led by three 3s each from Durant, Beal, and Dunn.
Pre-Game Insights: Phoenix coach Mike Budenholzer took longtime starters Beal and Jusuf Nurkic out of the lineup and had them come off the bench.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Suns' bench outscored Philadelphia's reserves 54-7.
Philadelphia was missing Joel Embiid, who was sidelined with a left foot sprain.
Guerschon Yabusele finished with 14 points and 10 rebounds for the 76ers.
